name: Eiffel Tower
description: The Eiffel Tower is an iconic wrought-iron lattice tower in city №1, standing tall at 324 meters. It was designed by Gustave Eiffel and built for the 1889 World's Fair, marking the 100th anniversary of the country №1 Revolution. The tower offers stunning panoramic views of city №1 from its observation decks and is one of the most visited paid monuments in the world.

name: Louvre Museum
description: The Louvre Museum is the world's largest art museum and a historic monument in city №1. Home to thousands of works of art, including the Mona Lisa and the Venus de Milo, the Louvre is a former royal palace that spans centuries of history and culture. The museum's collections range from ancient civilizations to the 19th century, making it a must-visit destination for art lovers.

name: Colosseum
description: The Colosseum in city №14 is an ancient amphitheater that dates back to 70-80 AD. Known for its grand architecture and historical significance, it was the largest amphitheater ever built and could hold up to 80,000 spectators. The Colosseum hosted gladiatorial contests, public spectacles, and dramas based on Classical mythology. It remains one of the most enduring symbols of the Roman Empire.

name: Sagrada Familia
description: The Sagrada Familia is an awe-inspiring basilica in Barcelona, designed by renowned architect Antoni Gaudí. Construction began in 1882 and continues to this day, with the basilica's unique blend of Gothic and Art Nouveau styles making it a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Its intricate facades and towering spires create a surreal landscape that attracts millions of visitors each year.

name: British Museum
description: The country №3 Museum in London is a public institution dedicated to human history, art, and culture. Established in 1753, it houses a vast collection of artifacts from all over the world, including the Rosetta Stone, the Elgin Marbles, and the Egyptian mummies. The museum's galleries provide a journey through time, offering insights into the achievements of ancient civilizations.

name: Acropolis of Athens
description: The Acropolis of Athens is an ancient citadel located on a rocky outcrop above the city, containing the remains of several historically significant buildings, including the Parthenon. Constructed in the 5th century BC, it stands as a symbol of the classical spirit and civilization of ancient country №4. The Acropolis offers a glimpse into the architectural and artistic achievements of the Athenian golden age.

name: Prado Museum
description: The Prado Museum in city №2 is one of the most renowned art museums in the world, known for its rich collection of European art from the 12th to the early 20th century. It features masterpieces by artists such as Velázquez, Goya, and El Greco. The museum's vast collection offers a deep dive into country №3 art history and includes some of the most famous works of the country №3 Golden Age.

name: Notre-Dame Cathedral
description: Notre-Dame Cathedral in city №1 is a medieval Catholic cathedral known for its French Gothic architecture, flying buttresses, and stunning stained-glass windows. Completed in the 14th century, it has been the site of many significant historical events. Despite suffering significant damage in the 2019 fire, the cathedral remains a symbol of country №1 heritage and resilience.

name: Van Gogh Museum
description: The Van Gogh Museum in country №5 houses the largest collection of Vincent van Gogh's paintings and drawings in the world. Highlights include the famous 'Sunflowers', 'The Bedroom', and 'Wheatfield with Crows', making it a must-visit for art enthusiasts.

name: Rijksmuseum

The museum's stunning architecture and vast collections offer a comprehensive look at the Netherlands' cultural heritage.

name: Great Wall of China
description: The Great Wall of country №7 is a series of fortifications built across northern China to protect against invasions. Spanning over 13,000 miles, it is one of the most remarkable architectural feats in history, showcasing various dynasties' engineering skills and is a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

name: Taj Mahal
description: The Taj Mahal is an ivory-white marble mausoleum in city №3, country №8, built in memory of Mumtaz Mahal, the wife of Mughal emperor Shah Jahan. Recognized as a symbol of love, it is an architectural masterpiece blending Islamic, Persian, Ottoman Turkish, and Indian styles and is a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

name: Petra
description: Petra is a historical and archaeological city in southern country №9, famous for its rock-cut architecture and water conduit system. Once the capital of the Nabataean Kingdom, it is one of the New Seven Wonders of the World and a UNESCO World Heritage Site, attracting visitors with its breathtaking views and rich history.

name: Table Mountain
description: Table Mountain is a flat-topped mountain overlooking City №4, Country №10. It is a significant landmark and a national park known for its unique biodiversity and stunning views of the city and ocean. Visitors can hike to the summit or take a cable car for breathtaking panoramas.

name: Machu Picchu
description: Machu Picchu is an ancient Incan citadel located in the Andes Mountains of Country №11. name: Statue of Liberty
description: The Statue of Liberty is a colossal neoclassical sculpture on Liberty Island in city №5 Harbor. A gift from country №1, it symbolizes freedom and democracy, welcoming immigrants arriving by sea. It stands at 151 feet tall and is a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

name: Christ the Redeemer
description: Christ the Redeemer is an iconic statue of Jesus Christ in city №6, Brazil. Standing 98 feet tall, it overlooks the city from the 700-meter peak of Corcovado Mountain. The statue is recognized as a symbol of Brazilian Christianity and offers stunning views of Rio.

name: Forbidden City
description: The Forbidden City in city №7 was the country №7 imperial palace from the Ming dynasty to the end of the Qing dynasty. It is a massive complex with over 980 buildings and has been a UNESCO World Heritage Site since 1987.

name: Angkor Wat
description: Angkor Wat is the largest religious monument in the world and a symbol of country №14. Built in the 12th century, it was originally a Hindu temple dedicated to Vishnu before becoming a Buddhist temple.

name: National Museum of Korea
description: The National Museum of country №15 in city №8 is the largest museum in Country №15 and houses a vast collection of artifacts ranging from ancient Korea to contemporary history.

name: Tokyo National Museum
description: The city №9 National Museum is the oldest сountry №16 national museum, showcasing a large collection of art and archeological artifacts from Country №16 and other Asian cultures.

description: The Islamic Arts Museum country №17 in city №10 displays an extensive collection of Islamic artifacts, ranging from textiles to ceramics, offering a deep insight into Islamic culture and history.

name: Louvre Abu Dhabi
description: Louvre city №11 is an art and civilization museum located in city №11, Country №18. Opened in 2017, it showcases works from various periods and regions, celebrating cultural connections.

name: Zeitz MOCAA
description: Zeitz Museum of Contemporary Art Africa (MOCAA) is the largest museum dedicated to contemporary art from Africa and its diaspora. Located in city №4, it features cutting-edge exhibits in a striking repurposed grain silo.

name: Great Zimbabwe Ruins
description: Great Zimbabwe is an ancient city in southeastern country №19 that was the capital of the Kingdom of Country №19 during the Late Iron Age. The ruins, which cover nearly 730 hectares, provide evidence of a highly advanced civilization.

name: Robben Island
description: Robben Island is known for housing political prisoners, including Nelson Mandela, during the apartheid era in country №10. It is now a UNESCO World Heritage Site and a symbol of the struggle for freedom.

description: The Smithsonian National Museum of American History in city №13, D.C., is dedicated to preserving and displaying artifacts related to the history and culture of the country №12.
